results.title: My father, my master = Padre, padrone.
results.creator_credit: Vittorio Taviani, Paolo Taviani, Guiliani de Negri and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: This brutal film is based on the autobiographical novel of the same name by Gavino Ledda which describes his youth and early adulthood as a shepard in the barren hill region of Sardinia. As a five year old Gavino was forcibly removed from school by his harsh peasant father who treated his eldest son as violently as he had been treated by his father before him. The illiterate Gavino eventually joined the army and educated himself to a point where he could stand up to his father and reject ancestral tradition and expectation. Though influenced greatly by Italian neo-realism, “Padre Padrone” also incorporates elements of fantasy and magical realism to convey the epic sweep of Gavino’s story. The author appears as himself in the prologue and epilogue. Both harrowing and deeply humanist, “Padre Padrone” richly deserved the Palme D’Or it won at Cannes in 1977.

results.title: The Strange love of Martha Ivers
results.creator_credit: Lewis Milestone, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Kirk Douglas made his film debut and Barbara Stanwyck starred as the malevolent Martha Ivers in this melodrama cum thriller which engages the viewer until its gripping climax. A strong supporting cast includes Lizabeth Scott, Van Heflin and Judith Anderson. Martha Ivers is a wicked but powerful woman who runs the town of Iverson after inheriting the family fortune. However, Martha has a deadly secret which threatens to ruin her life. As a teenager, Martha was responsible for the murder of her domineering Aunt so she could elope with her lover and the past has a way of catching up her despite her efforts to keep it buried.

results.title: Living free
results.creator_credit: Jack Couffer, Paul Radin, Carl Foreman and Columbia
results.brief_description: The sequel to “Born free” continues the adventures of Joy and George Adamson. Elsa the lioness brings her three cubs out of the wilderness to the couple who raised her. When Elsa suddenly dies, the cubs who cannot fend for themselves, attack domestic animals to survive before disappearing into the wild. The Adamson’s launch a desperate attempt to find the young lions and bring them to the safety of the game reserve. Starring Susan Hampshire and Nigel Davenport.

results.title: How to marry a millionaire
results.creator_credit: Jean Negulesco, Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marilyn”.
Lauren Bacall, Betty Grable and Marilyn Monroe are three glamorous models on the lookout for a rich man. Pooling their funds, they decide to rent a luxurious Manhattan penthouse in order to lure their catch. Things are not what they appear to be as two of them fall in love with “poor men.” In the attempt to stop each other from marrying the wrong man, the threesome give their best performances. Utimately, it is love and not money which influences their choices. This film is a must see for lovers of Marilyn Monroe’s quirky and individualistic comedy style.

results.title: Malice
results.creator_credit: Harold Becker, Charles Mulvehill, Rachel Pfeffer, New Line Cinema and Castle Rock
results.brief_description: Dr. Jed Hill (Alec Baldwin) is an eminent doctor and the new head surgeon at Westerly Hospital. The newlywed Tracy Safian (Nicole Kidman) is admitted to hospital requiring emergency surgery. Dr. Hill defiantly performs an unnecessary operation which leaves her unable to have children. Hit with a $20 million dollar law suit, the truth begins to unravel - this is not the first time the medical whiz with miracle hands has played God, but will it be the last?

results.title: Gypsy
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Philip Anderson, Mervyn LeRoy and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Gypsy Rose Lee, burlesque Queen of renown, was driven to stardom much less by her own ambition, than by the ruthless determination of her mother. As the stereotypical domineering “stage mother”, Rosalind Russell’s performance is superb, while Karl Malden as her long-suffering but loyal lover also gives a fine performance. While the references to striptease are undeniably fleeting, Natalie Wood as Gypsy Rose Lee is creditable, but it is her vulnerability rather than her sex appeal which comes to the fore. Stephen Sondheim’s lyrics and Julie Styne’s score makes this a musical delight.

results.title: Paint your wagon
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Alan Jay Lerner and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Lee Marvin and Clint Eastwood star in this famous film version of the the stage musical. Ben Rumson (Lee Marvin) is a hard-fighting, hard-drinking, happy-go-lucky man. His ‘Pardner’ (Clint Eastwood) on the other hand is sober, quiet and gentle. The story follows their adventures in a lawless gold mining town called No Name City (population: drunk). They stick together through thick and thin and share everything including a wife (Jean Seberg). Music and lyrics by Alan J. Lerner and Frederick Loewe

results.title: The Party
results.creator_credit: Blake Edwards, Mirisch Corporation and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Blake Edwards and Peter Sellers combine in another comic masterpiece. This time Sellers is not the bumbling Closeau, but the much maligned and accident-prone Indian actor Hrundi V. Bakshi. Hollywood mogul, Fred Clutterbuck is giving the Hollywood party of the century, complete with beautiful women, powerful men and “wanna-be stars.” Blackballed by his producer for wrecking a day’s shooting, Bakshi finds himself unexpectedly invited to the party. Once this walking disaster area enters the festivities, destruction and mayhem follows. A satire on the artifice and snobbery of Tinseltown and a must for lovers of Sellers’ unique comic style. Co-starring Claudine Longet, Marge Champion and Steve Franken with a musical score by Henry Mancini.

results.title: Cry-baby = Cry baby
results.creator_credit: John Waters, Rachel Talalay, Universal Pictures and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description: Johnny Depp is Wade “Cry-baby” Walker, a cool, tough but sensitive teenage delinquent. His ability to shed a single tear drives the girls wild. Cry-baby and his friends live on the outer edges of “normal society”. Their “badness” attracts the beautiful rich but square Allison and she is drawn into their rockabilly, fast car world. The soundtrack is excellent, and the rock ‘n roll era of the 1950’s is vividly recreated. Johnny Depp is appealing as Cry-baby and is well supported by co-stars Amy Locane, Susan Tyrell, Iggy Pop, Ricky Lake, Traci Lords and Polly Bergen. John Waters style is firmly stamped on this film as he recreates a nostalgia for an era.

results.title: A Farewell to arms
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, David O. Selznick, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Selznick Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: A remake of the 1932 classic tale by famed author Ernest Hemmingway. Rock Hudson stars as an American ambulance driver during World War I. Wounded in action, he is restored to health by an army nurse played by Jennifer Jones. However, their love affair is doomed as the war hangs like a spectre over their lives. Shot on location in the Dolomite region of Italy, the film is sentimentally tragic and never quite reaches the heights of the earlier version. Vittorio De Sica is excellent as the cynical Major Rinaldi, while Hudson and Jones make an attractive couple, but their performances are hampered by a cliched script.
